item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "She said she usually cried at least once each day not because she was sad, but because the world was so beautiful & life was so short." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Peter McWilliams
item.description: "It is a risk to love. What if it doesn't work out? Ah, but what if it does." -- Peter McWilliams

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "In my next life I want to live my life backwards. You start out dead and get that out of the way. Then you wake up in an old people's home feeling better every day. You get kicked out for being too healthy, go collect your pension, and then when you start work, you get a gold watch and a party on your first day. You work for 40 years until you're young enough to enjoy your retirement. You party, drink alcohol, and are generally promiscuous, then you are ready for high school. You then go to primary school, you become a kid, you play. You have no responsibilities, you become a baby until you are born. And then you spend your last 9 months floating in luxurious spa-like conditions with central heating and room service on tap, larger quarters every day and then Voila! You finish off as an orgasm!" -- Woody Allen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "I'm not young enough to know everything." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "When I fall in love, it will be forever." -- Jane Austen

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by oscar wilde
item.description: "You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear." -- oscar wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A bore is someone who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Only my books anoint me, and a few friends, those who reach into my veins." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: MarieLise add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Depression is boring, I think and I would do better to make some soup and light up the cave." -- Anne Sexton
